website_summaries.verdict: The best all around Timex wrist watch that can survive a lot of abuse during physical activities.
pros: Digital readout features large numbers and a built-in light
Buttons are easy to press while running, biking, or otherwise exercising
cons: The built-in alarms are known to fail occasionally or may go off at a different, non-set time

website_summaries.verdict: Reliable and affordable, this dive watch also features rugged construction to hold up through intense periods of activity.
pros: Water-resistant to 330 feat and includes Indiglo buttons to illuminate the screen in low-light conditions
Capable of tracking up to 99 laps over 100 hours
Easy to read screen and comfortable, stain-resistant resin strap
cons: Lacks the curb appeal of high-end dive watches, and battery may die sooner than expected
For a bit more money, you can invest in the better-quality model

customer_reviews.title: Fool me once....
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fool repeatedly. Over the past 10 years I have purchased about 6 Ironman watches and every time the band breaks. The watches have always been great with all the functionality that I need but the bands always deteriorate or in the last case don't with stand a very hardy workout. The name Ironman is definitely not the proper name for these watches. Fool me no more
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for money watch! I've taken this watch fresh out of the box swimming in the beach, running, and wearing it everyday. I'm safe to say that, there isn't any issue with the watch whatsoever. It also fits my skinny 5.5 inch wrist perfectly in the last hole, which is a big plus for all you other small wrists guys out there. Since i doubt theres anyone with smaller wrist than me. >:P
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Tang

customer_reviews.title: Can’t read it because display is way too dark
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many of these same watches, except before they were the black and grey ones. The display on this is so dark I can’t read it without pushing the light button. Hoping they call me about this issue as I really need a watch. I got this specific color because it was the cheapest but if I can even look to see what time it is then it’s useless. I’ll put in a return inquiry and will try to update when they contact me
customer_reviews.author: justanopinion

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this watch as a gift for my father. It's a low profile watch with functionality, durability, reliability and strength. I graduated basic training over a decade ago and had the same model all through training until 10+ years later. This is the perfect watch for anyone who works for a living and is unable to look at their cell phone every 10 mins to check the time. Great watch that stays on your wrist and works as promised. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: AirForceReserve

customer_reviews.title: I'm so thankful I own this watch
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful watch. The user experience is great. The face is easy to read, quick access to the chronometer and the watch is not bulky. At a very affordable price, this watch is a jewel. BTW, this is my second Ironman watch. Three years ago, I first purchased the less expensive model. I put that Ironman watch through hundreds of hours in the pool and it is still working like new.
customer_reviews.author: papakenx

customer_reviews.title: DimWits
customer_reviews.text: What kind of dimwitted company sells a watch like this without including instructions for how to use all of its functions?? I mean, seriously, do we have to stumble around experimenting, trying to figure out how to set this or that? It doesn't get any dumber than this. Timex is clearly too cheap to include something as simple as ...INSTRUCTIONS!!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: 5 Year Review!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this watch now for a little over 5 years. It's been through chlorinated pools, soap, mud, oil, gasoline, countless hot showers, and I think I might have even taken it into the ocean with me. I can't even imagine how many times its been dropped and bumped up against other objects while wearing it. Even after all that, it still works like it did when it was brand new. And I haven't even had to change the batteries even once! This is my favorite watch by far, even more than the $200 Luminox I once owned. I highly recommend this tank of a watch to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: William Sibley

customer_reviews.title: Very bad warranty process
customer_reviews.text: I have had this watch since late march of this year. It is now the end of August and I have had to put 3 new batteries in it. Each time I have a new battery put in the watch works great for about a month. Now Timex wants me to pay 8 bucks to have another watch sent to me. This watch is bad. Send me a new one. I paid for one that works.
customer_reviews.author: hans

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: really nice - simple, readable and quite comfortable. overall really good value for the money if you like your sport watch not to be so damn big like the g shocks
customer_reviews.author: ziv elimelech

customer_reviews.title: Band and buttons of higher quality now? If you already liked Ironman watches, you might love this one!
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Ironman watches for years. Usually for me the band breaks, but the watch runs forever even after that. This watch seems more rugged - the band is thicker and more robust. Even the button pushes feel more substantial. I've lost count of how many of these watches I've owned so far, but after about a month with this one, so far it's my favorite. BTW the buttons all work the same too - out of the box and on your wrist and working like before in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: My husband's favorite watch
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing Timex Ironman since I have known him. He went though a few of them just because the band around it wears down after a few years. He doesn't take the watch off at all. He always wants this watch when asked what he wants for Christmas. Last year I bought nicer looking and better ( so I thought) watch ( Gshock) just for a difference. My husband didn't look too excited about it but he gave it a try but when asked what he wants for Christmas this year he still says Timex Ironman :) So that is what I just got him again :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: indiglo function stoped working after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have used timex ironman watches for the past 15 years, however, on the the last two ironman watches I have purchased, the Indiglo feature has died in less than a year. I have read on various blogs that this is a battery saver issue within the design of the watch, basically when the indiglo function failes, it is a "battery needs to be replaced" indicator, and once the battery is replaced, the indiglo function works again. I purchased this in August of 2015; the indiglo feature failed in February 2016. I had the battery replaced, and the indiglo feature did not begin working. This is the second such failure.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Needed to be lightweight w/ an easy to read screen
customer_reviews.text: Needed a simple digital watch for playing around on the weekends and going to the gym. Needed to be lightweight w/ an easy to read screen. you can customize it a bit. For 35 bucks you can't go wrong. It is very light-weight which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Sporty and durable watch priced right
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive but reasonably durable watch for gym, biking and at the pool. I had read mixed reviews about the Ironman's water resistancy and initially I removed the watch when swimming. However, I thought I would give it a try and starting swimming with it on. I've been in the pool about a hundred times now with the watch on and its doing just fine, no molisture or other issues. I do leisurely laps and don't dive. The dial doesn't wash out in the sun as say my iPhone does, so no problems at the outside pool. Its comfortable, has a nice sporty look and the strap has stood up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Errol AZ

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with this as the watch model had good features ...
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of this model watch from Amazon.com and each the INDIGLO stopped working after circa six -months. At first, I thought it was because I used the INDIGLO excessively. When it happened again, I changed the battery and it wouldn't work at all. I am very disappointed with this as the watch model had good features and were very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: True lies and legal covers
customer_reviews.text: Water resistant must be legalise for DO NOT PLACE NEAR WATER, EVER!!! Light swimming in my 3 feet deep intex pool allowed a level bubble to form inside the face. The intex pool is hardly 100 meters or 100 m ( maybe "m" doesnt mean meters.) Overly expensive watch ruined!!!
customer_reviews.author: Malik_77

customer_reviews.title: Solid watch but.....
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive watch that keeps accurate time and lightweight. I have owned at least three of these watches over several years and they are hard to beat for the inexpensive cost and functionality. I deducted one star and would have been two star reduction had I not owned this watch for several years. My only complaint with this recent purchase is that it came with absolutely no instructions how to operate the watch. There was information about the warranty written in about 12 different languages but no information how to operate the watch. YouTube is a beautiful thing and there was an excellent tutorial. I recommend the watch but still can not believe it shipped with no operation instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Vrodmoe

customer_reviews.title: nice watch but no instructions on how to get funtions to work--
customer_reviews.text: NIce watch, period and especially for the good price, but having an instruction sheet in 14 languages including my languge (English) that only has information battery types and not one word about settings, and which button sequences to push to get some functions takes it from a 5-star to a 3 star-two of the functions I wanted but don't have to have---I cannot figure out how to do it. I have 5 college degrees so like I can usually figure things out!
customer_reviews.author: Ckalba22

customer_reviews.title: Good Watch As Long As Light Button Lasts
customer_reviews.text: My consistent problem with Timex Ironman sports watch, which I like a lot, is the light button is the thing that breaks down. I checked my orders list after my light button stopped working today, the watch lasted 17 months. I don't think I press it more than most people. But that's the consistent glitch with this watch. Will ask a watch store if they know of a more durable sports watch.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Comerford

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, lousey watch band
customer_reviews.text: I really like the watch itself and i believe it to be a good value. This is the 4 or 5th one that i have owned (20 yrs?). None of the previous watches quit working, they were just worn out to the point that you could not read the markings on the plastic case. However, i am not a big fan of the rubber watch band. I would prefer the stainless steel band that i had on my last watch but i guess that has been discontinued. Still, i bought this one with the rubber watch band and i hope that i will not be disappointed down the road.
customer_reviews.author: stryder13

customer_reviews.title: takes a licking....
customer_reviews.text: This is my 8th iron man watch since about 1985. They are dependable, accurate and I am intimately acquainted with its features and functions. Technically I could replace the batteries in these, but then the water resistance would be compromised. I swim, water ski and some snorkeling and diving and have no complaints. it is inexpensive offers great utility (it even reminds me of my wife's birthday and our anniversary.)
customer_reviews.author: BShel

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Timex watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this same watch every 4 years for the last 10 years. I love it. They're durable, long-lasting, and stylish. The only negative thing I can think of is that eventually the band will wear out and the little rubber keeper that holds the band down may break completely off. But that's after 4 or 5 years of consistent wear in all types of weather conditions - so I'd say these watches are totally worth the cost. Once this one falls apart, I'll be buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Mom 🐱Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, lite, functional and ok looks
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this watch for at least 15 years. When the battery dies or the strap breaks, I simply recycle it and buy another. I wear it all the time and use: time of day, calendar, stop watch and indeglo all the time. I would have rated it 5 stars but they put a stupid ironman sticker on the face that obscures the watch face. What a stupid thing to do. Geez. Other than the sticker, my only complaint is that I can't change the amount of time the watch is lit up when you press the indiglo button. OEM is too short a time for me in most cases.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid watch, great workout companion.
customer_reviews.text: A great watch for timing exercises and breaks between sets. It’s simple and intuitive to use, lights up well, and is comfortable to wear in any condition. Plenty rugged, shows no signs of where despite regular use on and off the wrist. The timer and stop watch operations are a little clunky, and resetting the stop watch can be a bit annoying as it takes a second or two to reset while depressing the reset button. But overall very pleased with it. Definitely worth the price and a value over smart watches that do far more than I need.
customer_reviews.author: asm154

customer_reviews.title: making them easy to read without the glow being so bright (e
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing various Timex sport watches for years, and this one has all the usual features along with some improvements. The indigo now makes the numbers glow on a dark screen, making them easy to read without the glow being so bright (e.g in a theater). There is now an option to disable some of the alarms and features you don't use. The holes in the band seem slightly closer together, make it easier to get a close fit. There are also many styles and colors to choose from. I am very pleased with the this new watch!
customer_reviews.author: kamikasee

customer_reviews.title: Poor button placement
customer_reviews.text: I have used this watch for 4 years, and it is still going strong on the original battery. My only complaint is that with the placement of the buttons, it is very easy to hit the MODE button at the same time as the INDIGLO as you "pinch" the watch between your thumb and finger. Almost every time I try to read my watch in the dark using INDIGLO, I end up stuck cycling through the menu and accidentally turning on alarms. I'm guessing this won't be an issue for a lot of people, but I won't be buying another one for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Numbers and letters too light - different from ad...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I've been disappointed in a product I got from Amazon. I bought the timex strictly from the ad on Amazon that showed a nice looking watch with very dark numbers and letters on the face. My vision isn't as good as it used to be because of age. The product I got looked nearly the same, except the numbers were very light, gray and a thinner font than appeared in the ad. I can barely see it in the light of day so it's useless to me. I've learned my lesson. .
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Davisson

customer_reviews.title: NO INTERVAL TIMER
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch. I bought it Because I liked the looks and must have read the feature set wrong.... I bought it for the interval timer function and was disappointed to find it didn't have it!!! I didn't send it back because I figured it it was my fault. I sure wish it had an intervals function
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Mosher

customer_reviews.title: Durable and an improvement from the Slim 50
customer_reviews.text: After three failed attempts at the Slim 50 by Timex it was time to purchase a more durable watch from the company. The Classic 30 is just enough for daily wear. Time (24-hour), date (MM/DD or DD/MM), and day in the primary face with the option to adjust The face is larger and thicker than the Slim 50, but the durability of the watch is so much greater. There are low expectations I will brake the band of the watch within the first year. Well worth the $35 purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: The Hulls

customer_reviews.title: I love this watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool new color scheme for a watch that I've used for years, all the same great features of any ironman watch, with the modern design and colors. The photo is pretty much true to how it appears in real life, and in case you know the difference between the old indiglo and the new indiglo, this one has the new indiglo where the numbers are glowing rather than the whole background. This full-size is great because it's not as small as the women's or midsize, and it's smaller than the oversized giant ones you can get.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Timer numbers too small no sound no instructions
customer_reviews.text: Would be a nice watch as I like the fact that there are no major parts sticking out while referee a soccer game so that nobody gets injured. But mine arrive DOA as the chime and beep sound never worked even I have turned it on. The countdown timer on all Timex iron watches I have seen are in too small numbers and are not as cool looking as on Casio watches. Need to be able to set Alarms for a specific week day not just all week work days, this seems not to be possible. Had to pay $1 to return a defective unit thanks to my Amazon prime.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Studer

customer_reviews.title: My third one
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this watch for over 15yrs. I'm on my 3rd one, they always last me several years and the band ends up cracking but the watch itself has never died! I wear mine daily, work in healthcare so wash my hands countless times a day. Never had any water get in the screen or cause fogging. The background light never has stopped working either. I'll be sad if they ever discontinue this model it's has all the features you need and takes a beating and still lasts.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Product has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this watch for probably 15-20 years and always loved it. Other than replacing the battery, I've had no issues till this past year. I have now gone through 2 watches as the light goes out after just a few months. For some, that might not be an issue, but for a runner in the early morning hours when you want to see your times (esp if doing intervals, etc) it's a real problem. I'm not sure whether to try it again with a new one, or switch to another watch altogether. Very disappointed as I have loved this watch in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: True classic, still a great watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted an inexpensive, durable all weather watch. I've had this model before and lost it after having it for years. This is a good watch, and hits all the high points. There are more expensive watches in the Timex Ironman line that have better water resistance or does more laps (100m/30 laps for this watch), but I didn't need those features. I happily spent less money and still got a watch that did everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: bturnip

customer_reviews.title: Sporty and durable and has Indiglo
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my 14 year old nephew. I have owned a couple of ladies iron man watches and they are wonderful. They are so easy to set, have multiple alarms, chrono, indigo light up screen and water resistant to 100m. He loved it. He's very active in sports and swimming so I'm curious to see how it does. I'm sure he will give it a workout like I never gave mine. He's small for his age and it fit just fine. I would recommend a timex ironman watch for anyone who is active and may have their watch in the water. They are also very comfortable and the face is moderate size. Not too big.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My husband got a g-shock at the same I ordered this watch and if you want a stylish sturdy watch that doubles as a sports watch the g-shock wins hands down...But if you want a watch just for working out this is the winner. I use a count down timer when I exercise and the Timex is so user friendly...simple to set, no instructions needed, and the display is big and easy to read. It does not look half bad either just not as stylish compared to a g-shock. Wore it in my pool no issues.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: I love these watches because they typically last a long time
customer_reviews.text: A solid ironman watch that is priced well. I love these watches because they typically last a long time, and aside from an occasional battery change, they "keep on tickin' and can take a lickin' ". Don't have to take them off before showering, and the indiglo light comes in handy at night. Stop watch works very well, and it was fairly easy to set the correct time and date. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Al T.

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Read
customer_reviews.text: I chose the version of white numbers/letters on a black backgroud but this is very difficult to read. Because the white letters are basically gray-brown and fade into the background on quick viewing. This makes scanning your watch for the time very difficult. And isn't that the purpose of a wrist watch no matter how inexpensive? I would not recommend this version. All the basic functions of aTimex watch work as usual.
customer_reviews.author: EAmigo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good deal
customer_reviews.text: The watch looks good. My only wish is that it was a bit larger. "Full size" was listed and it just seems a bit small. Hard to measure by their standards. I do like the face and it is lightweight and fits beneath my sleeve cuff. Hopefully it lasts. My last watch, a competitor, came apart after 9 months with screws loose or missing. The costs of fixing was 2/3 of the cost of this watch. Hopefully Timex will take a licking and keep on ticking.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Good Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I like Timex because they are very durable. I go through watches quickly because I never take my watch off. If it can endure me for two years I'm usually happy. My biggest problems that I have with most of my Timex Ironman watches are that the rubber wrist band breaks. The wrist bands on these watches at least the rubber ones are comfortable. This one seems to be doing much better than my past ones. I will have to give an updated post as time goes by but so far six months and it is doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Paul Boyden

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the watch after about 6 months. All my previous ironman watches have lasted a decade or so, I usually lose and then refind them multiple times in their lifespan. On my past ironman watches, the sealing eventually oxidizes and cracks after 2 or 3 battery changes, which is 10 to 20 years. My last one was still working, but I could see cracks in the gasket, so I knew it wasn't going to be waterproof anymore, so I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Rau

customer_reviews.title: Nearly unchanged for 3 decades for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Ironman watch over 20 years and is just as good as the others. I did lament when the start and stop became 2 different buttons, since I didn't use it for split times, but it works great either way. It has previously been across the Alcatraz swim twice and in countless triathlons. It's a durable as a hammer and works great. The night lite is nice as a reverse backlight. Can't beat it for a lightweight minimalist watch.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: I Recommend This Watch to Anyone
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product consistently for roughly 10 years. I have enjoyed it so much that I recently ordered this second copy when the battery died on the original one. This watch is great in that it provides full digital data, is light weight and comfortable to wear. I particularly like the alarm function. I regularly set the 3 alarms at 5 minutes intervals in case I might want to snooze. I have found the watch to keep perfect time. I would recommend this watch to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: 30 years same model
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing the exact same model of watch for thirty years. I replace it about once every five years. I’m a professional pilot and it does everything I need in an easy straightforward manner. You’ll never impress anyone with this thing and it won’t calculate your Mach number by inputting your indicated airspeed and your saturated air temperature but I find those watches gimmicky. This is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Green

customer_reviews.title: Backlight stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace same watch I only had for a year because the back light no longer worked so I received this new watch for $40 and I see the original year of the watch when it was made was 2012 and the back light is barely seen. So it will probably only last less than a year and then I’m ordering another one.....what a racket....
customer_reviews.author: Buttser

customer_reviews.title: Durable watch with feeble band
customer_reviews.text: I've used Ironman watches for decades, and they're generally utilitarian designs I like. You can wear them in the rain, in the shower, while rock climbing, etc, without having to worry about banging them up. But why do the watch straps have such a short lifespan before they start cracking? And with so many Ironman models, each with a different strap, it's hard to find either Timex or generic replacements.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shankland

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice and works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son who uses it daily in his job to time things (he is a chemist). Actually, I bought him two since two is one and one is none! No, really, he forgot the first one at my house one weekend after a visit, so I bought him another identical one and had it shipped to him quickly. Easier than going to the post office to mail a package. Anyway, he really likes it and it works well for him, so five stars. The color is bronze-ish, not boring gray in spite of the description.
customer_reviews.author: Marta SolitaireTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: User manual?
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from my Timex Marathon. The Marathon battery died. I haven't found a way to replace the batteries in these things in a way that maintains the water resistance. I would give it five stars if instructions had been included. The very fine print paper included only mentioned warranty information and a warning against pressing the buttons when under water. You might think there would be mention of a link for a user manual. Finding one online wasn't hard, but the instructions would have been unreadable without zooming in.
customer_reviews.author: rblaw

customer_reviews.title: Solid, maybe a little too solid
customer_reviews.text: This is a go-to favorite watch for me for many years. Perfect for travelers and sports enthusiasts. A Swiss Army knife of the watch world. One small complaint; the plastic case d band have been reformulated with a harder plastic and it has twice now rubbed the lateral aspect of my wrist raw of the little bony prominence known anatomically as the ulnar styloid process. Takes a long time to heal. I've adapted by pushing the watch up my arm bit higher.
customer_reviews.author: JB Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: INACCURATE. It's a good Toy for a kid. It loses too much time.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Timex iron man watch for years prior to buying this replacement. The band broke. I need an accurate watch for work. A loss of 1 second a month is acceptable. This one is losing 2 seconds a day. If you want a Toy get this watch. I've never had a watch do this so I tossed the package & now can't return it so I took the loss. I replaced this with a Casio Men's F108WH Illuminator Collection Black Resin Strap Digital Watch. It's a cheap POS but hasn't lost a second in weeks. Why a cheap watch then? Cause I'm not spending a lot of $$ on a work watch.
customer_reviews.author: Dantrax

customer_reviews.title: Love Timex Ironman
customer_reviews.text: I'm hard on watches, and Timex Ironman is one of the few that will hold up. This is my third one; #2 still works after 10 years, but it's pretty banged up and the band is shot so I picked up a new one. The current model is basically unchanged, which is fine because it's just about perfect. In ten years when I've trashed this one, I'll probably buy another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: RobDog

customer_reviews.title: This watch was a dud!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son both own these watches. My son has worn his for 5 years. My husbands died a little while ago and we couldn't find any in stores. Knowing I was paying extra for it, I ordered one on Amazon. It worked for a month then went totally blank. As in, nothing!! It is past the return window and the chat helper seems to think I can read a dead screen and wants me to push buttons that aren't there. I am very disappointed with this watch and purchase. Timex Ironman watches are generally wonderful. BUT THIS ONE IS TERRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Fox

customer_reviews.title: Basic features for all runners out there
customer_reviews.text: I misplaced the same watch and had to replace with another Timex. This is a medium size watch for those of us who do not need to look like Wonder woman bullet blocking bracelets. I wear this watch for exercise, taking a shower, and swimming. The water doesn't get into the watch. The only warning for water failure is pushing a button while the watch is submerged. This is easy to read, especially while running.
customer_reviews.author: El Pitufo Grunon

customer_reviews.title: It really does take a lickin' and keep on tickin'
customer_reviews.text: Probably my 6th Iron Man (or Atlantis) in the last 20 years. I thought I liked it before, now it's even better with the ability to set times forward or backward. This saves crucial seconds. The battery died in my last one, but it was a few years old when I got my first Fitbit HR. Normal wear and tear trashed that, they sent me a new one. The same wear and tear that the Timex handles with no problem trashed the 2nd Fitbit HR, too. For the money, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: MCampbell

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant set of features. Had these since 1988. Between backpacking, kitchen work, sailing, scuba, and just general abuse, mine last about 5 years. I've never has one fail, or the battery go dead. The plastic, while trough, eventually wears out and gets scuffed, paint rubs off, etc. The three alarms is nice. One to wake up at 6am, then 7am and 7pm as reminders to take vitamins. It's iconic enough to not look odd in a business formal setting. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Good for sport
customer_reviews.text: I go running as a hobby, and have never been involved in any actual track or anything so I don't know anything about splits or proper running times or whatever. I use it for my own recording of my sprinting intervals. I also do it for weightlifting to keep track of how long between sets and such. all I know is I absolutely hate wearing watches, but have not taken this one off. It is a nice, lightweight watch. It has a lot of features I can't ocmmend on as I don't use them too much, but I am glad I got this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Scott

customer_reviews.title: Rugged watch for everyday wear.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one virtually identical watch for many years. It was time to replace the battery, the band is finally wearing out, and my bird chewed up the face somewhat, but it keeps on running. I’ve decided I’ve got my money’s worth and I am replacing it. This one is slightly more colorful, and has a different backlight, but should last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: WTS

customer_reviews.title: Built like a plastic tank
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my previous Timex. My first one lasted over ten years and didn't even need a battery change. It finally died when my confidence in its indestructability led me to wear it into a hotspring. Somehow it finally died. I bought this one the moment I had my phone next. 9 month update - By all evidence this one is shaping up to be as good and as durable as the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Bhosley

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé’s old Ironman finally wore out and I surprised him with this one. It was exactly what I was looking for. The watch face is not too big and not too small, it’s a little bigger than a quarter and a little smaller than a half dollar. It has all of the features as his old one and the band is easy to clean. He hasn’t been in the water yet to test the water resistance. But he loves the backlight!
customer_reviews.author: Katey

customer_reviews.title: This Watch Is A Classic Timeless Timepiece
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many Timex Ironman watches over decades. As a matter of fact, once I put one on, I never take it off of my wrist.! They are so durable, useful for timing , setting various alarms simultaneously and for my purposes, waterproof. The last one I had remained in service for almost 4 years on the original battery. I only bought a new one recently because the start/split button got worn down. For my money ($41.00) including tax, you can't go wrong with this Timex watch series. Even the styling is clean and classic. The model I own is all classy black. For daily use, this one can't be beat!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Conner

customer_reviews.title: A nice looking watch with great functionality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Timex Ironman Classic 30 after receiving a new Casio (with an alarm that did not function) which I returned. I very much like the Timex Ironman. The functions are useful and easy to learn, the watch and band feel good on my wrist, it looks great, I like the Indigo lighted numbers, and I love the LARGE figures on the screen (it is easy to read). I cannot personally comment on the durability of the watch yet, but friends tell me that it is extremely durable so I am hopeful.
customer_reviews.author: Everette B. Orr

customer_reviews.title: A bit Plain, enough for an old school athlete who visits several time zones.  Lasts close to forever
customer_reviews.text: I think I’m on my 5th one. They last forever. Per the Internet, I have a large man’s wrist, but I guess those websites never heard of Texas, where I’m at most average. Anyway, I hate for my watches to be bulky, so this size seems perfect. My last watch lasted over ten years, maybe because I stopped using the daily alarm and abusing it while climbing as I got older. I highly recommend it, unless of course you buy into the latest smart watch craze or like gaudy pimp-like bling.
customer_reviews.author: h2o

customer_reviews.title: husband father day watch
customer_reviews.text: Well we are getting older but the package came crusted and he can't see it , you can't see what time it is unless you push the button he wanted to just be able to look down and see the time!!! I order it because it said it would fit a big man wrist, barly he can only get it on the last hole! So I'm not happy with this product I wanted him to be Happy but he is not. Well it has quit completely
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Replaced The Identical Watch.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a replacement for the same item. The previous ( same version ) was replaced because the watch band clasp was lost. Love the watch except over time the band gets stretched and the rubber piece that holds the band position in place slips off and gets lost. Could not find the missing piece, so it was just as easy too replace it by purchasing a “new” complete watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F.

customer_reviews.title: MATCHED EXACTLY THE ONE THAT WAS WORN OUT
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for years. I have replaced batteries and wrist bands. the watch face is exactly the right size for my wrist. the larger face watches are very uncomfortable. When the old watch got worn out beyond repair I was desperate to find the exact model, and there it was on Amazon. I am very pleased. I wear this watch every single day.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Vonstetina

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase in 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: My old model of this watch just started to fail. The model button doesn't work, but the watch lasted me 5 years of daily use, from the sauna to the ocean to the pool. I like the feel of the brand new buttons on this model. Easy to push compared to my broken watch. Lol I definitely recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Ultra K.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, durable, affordable, no-nonsense watch
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing these Timex Men's Ironman watches for over a decade now. Pros: - Affordable (~$35) - Durable (the only replacements have been do to loss) I wear it running, camping, working, etc. This watch gets the job done and doesn't fool around with extra features.
customer_reviews.author: College Student

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard to Read
customer_reviews.text: The black screen is deceiving in the pictures. It is VERY hard to read the screen when its on your wrist. I've had multiple Ironman watches over the years and this black screen is terrible. I'm sending back and ordering the usual white/gray screen.
customer_reviews.author: Staffer

customer_reviews.title: No User Manual
customer_reviews.text: The major problem with the Ironman Classic 30 is that it is out of production and it does not come with instructions on how to set the time and configure its features. Since it is out of production, the instruction manual is not provided on the Timex support webpage. I had to use the Ironman 50+ instruction manual to configure the watch. I bought this watch to replace the original Ironman when its wrist strap broke. The wrist strap on the Classic 30 is much more comfortable than the original Ironman and the Classic 30 has more features, including a repeating countdown timer, which I especially wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Edward T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, easy to use features
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. This is the third one I've owned, and the company still makes the exact same model as my first one! I'm grateful for that. The main problem with the first two I had is that the buttons eventually become very hard to press. But that has taken years to happen on the previous two watches like this one that I've had. I like the watch so much that I don't consider that to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: drsHurley

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to keep me coming back
customer_reviews.text: I really like the functions on this watch and I find them easy to use, whether timing something in the kitchen or using the chronometer on a run. The downside is that the buttons begin to fail after two or three years. I'm on my third watch. The other two are still running. On the oldest one is still running after about 6 years, but the time set button no longer works so I can't set the stop watch or adjust the time. On the second watch, purchased a couple years ago, one of the buttons tends to stick in the depressed state, causing the watch to beep unexpectedly in an annoying way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for a good pric
customer_reviews.text: I won my first Ironman watch in a raffle and I loved it. Used it for many years before the battery finally went dead. Tried to change the battery but the screws were locked down. Rather than pay a jeweler to change it, and maybe fail also, I just ordered a new one for not much difference in price. I particularly like the sturdy band and the large display.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hedden

customer_reviews.title: I liked it enough to buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 10-year-old version of the same watch that finally wore out. I had replaced the band once and the battery a few times on the old watch. When the band broke again I decided to get a new watch. It's a nice, lightweight watch. The digital display is easy to read even if I'm not wearing my glasses while I'm running. I'm going to try to be more careful with the loop that holds the free end of the watch band so it doesn't break on me again. There are less expensive watches but I really like the stopwatch and countdown timer features and the feel of this watch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch, But I Hate the Display
customer_reviews.text: I have had an Ironman watch from Timex for years. I usually get 4 to 5 years out of each. And I am rough on a watch. They are great time pieces and keep accurate time. I like the alarm feature and the timer. I received this watch and immediately I knew I would not like it because of the display. You have to be in the light or complete dark and using the Indiglow feature to see the display. I guess I’ll give this away as a gift and get another Timex Ironman watch with a better display.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating but keeps poor time...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd or 4th of these watches I've owned. They take a reliable beating and their waterproofing is brilliant. That said, I have to reset the time every month or so as it will lose 1-2 minutes a month. For the price, I can't complain too much, but a watch that doesn't keep accurate time? Hard to give full marks.
customer_reviews.author: Firewing2

customer_reviews.title: It's about time, it's about space
customer_reviews.text: This watch is a replacement for my 25 yr old ironman that was possibly stolen by nefarious individuals. This watch is like going from a Model T Ford to a really good 1937 Ford Cabriolet or maybe a three window coupe. It's THAT good. The buttons work, it tells me the time and it beeps. The fast wrap IS, indeed, fast. I use this watch for running and it hasn't fallen off my wrist. I put a little wrist compass on the strap to be that much cooler. I feel sorry for everyone else because they're not me. So, even though this watch won't make you me, it will make you seem a little more like me.
customer_reviews.author: Watchmandu reviews

customer_reviews.title: Shipping issues compromise a good product
customer_reviews.text: Received my replacement watch for one that I purchased four years ago. It was shipped in a large non-padded shipping envelope and the box was seriously crushed. The time piece had 3.2016 on the active face which leads me to wonder just how old this watch is and how much battery time is left? These are not easy watches to change batteries so I am concerned that I may not get much life out of this. A possibly dated product and shoddy shipping leaves a questionable experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality time and again
customer_reviews.text: I love Timex watches for their different functions and style; however, their quality is poor. Both of my last two timex watches have lasted about 9 months. The first one had the light go out on it. I didn't replace it I just went without. The second watch has moisture under the lens making it difficult to read. I may have to replace this since it's annoying and difficult to see the time. Ugh! (Timex Women's Ironman 30-Lap Digital Quartz...)
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Got my watch and am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Got my watch and am very pleased with it. Was thinking of getting a Casio G-Shock. I've always worn the ironman watches by Timex, but the last two I had the indiglo light stopped working on both. I'm hoping this is not the case with my new Ironman cause I really like the look of the watch. And I've had the G-shock before and they are nice watches but are kind of complicated to use and have stuff like tide readings and moon readings that I could give a rats behind about.
customer_reviews.author: terrierdude39

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I've had an ironman watch for the last 35 years and finally am on numer 5. They used to last and work well with much activity. My latest one however broke around one year with the light not functioning. They used to take care of their stuff but when I called they said it has to be within one year or it would be a $30 service fee. Absolutely my last Timex. Incredibly dissapointed after thinking they used to be the best for fitness and activity. Will move to the G-Shock.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: A simple watch that allows me to track my exercise walking.
customer_reviews.text: This watch replaced my previous nearly identical Ironman that served well for many, many years. The old one failed as the gasket was damaged replacing the battery multiple times (my fault), and also the buttons became unreliable after thousands of runs and walks. I loved having the new watch. (I do not use the light, timers or alarms much, but they work fine.)
customer_reviews.author: LarryinMN

customer_reviews.title: Reliable favorite
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many of these watches and am always satisfied. My only complaint is that it is hard to find an identical watch band if the original breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas D

customer_reviews.title: Good watch but not easy set up
customer_reviews.text: A relative had this watch and my husband liked it. So when his broke I got this one. But it was difficult to set, change time etc. Did not have any booklet or directions. We had to go to YouTube and internet. Then buttons did not seem to function properly. We finally got it all set up but it took about half a day! Now, he’s happy with it! Loves the indigo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be gentle with the band when removing the watch.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for an inexpensive watch. Be careful that the band is not folded back too much when removing the watch. Otherwise, the band will crack sooner needing replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Lapierre

customer_reviews.title: This is a great watch, but I found doing a battery change ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch, but I found doing a battery change to be very problematic. The black resin straps need to be removed first to get the back cover off. They are difficult to remove and even more difficult to get back on. The lesson I learned is to either take it to a professional or buy a new watch (which I need to do now because I wad unable to make it water tight again, apparently).
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: don't care for the branding
customer_reviews.text: Watch is basic. Indigo makes it easy to read at night, and stop watch and 30-lap system are easy to use. I had a few runs in heavy rain and it was easy to read despite water on the watch and in my eyes. My issue with the watch is the branding. On the face of the watch reads "Ironman triathlon". This is needless and at some angles can slightly obstruct your view of the watch. The picture of the watch makes it look like it is flush with the face of the watch but it is actually elevated above the face.
customer_reviews.author: DWA

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but instructions... meh.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the watch. Good for the workout uses I have. Some extra stuff I don't need. The one thing I noticed (but not a one start penalty) is with the instructions. They come double sided on a 2 ft x 2ft sheet of paper, three columns on each side, the usual #6 font. The three columns are English, French, and Spanish. So I figured I would just cut off the French and Spanish instructions and toss them, and keep the English instructions. You would think they would match the languages front and back. Nope. On the sides, it's English-Spanish, and vice versa. The French, who are in the center on both sides, come out well though.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Robust Time Keeping
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new Timex Triathalon watch whenever I wear out the old one. I swim, run, and bike and this watch has every feature I want. It's a good value. Your phone has more features but it's hard to smash a wristwatch under a weight at the gym. I literally never take it off. It's my alarm clock, my timer, and it will give me splits at the track or in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Richard V.

customer_reviews.title: This is my husband's favorite watch. There is an alarm and timer that ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is exceptional for the price. It holds up and keeps time perfectly. This is my husband's favorite watch. There is an alarm and timer that makes it perfect when you don't have cell phone coverage or access to a cell phone. My husband is a mechanic and has had this watch before. Due to his work he needed to order another one because after 13 years it finally died. This one is the exact watch and is equally amazing. Highly recommend as a gift for the man in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Baer

customer_reviews.title: this watch is straight boss
customer_reviews.text: programmed and ready to go in 3 seconds......will last for years like the last 3 timex ironman I've owned.....reliable in combat overseas.....athletics....restaurant....and office work college and overseas and continental travel and camping....even survived 3 years of homelessness
customer_reviews.author: kaotic

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, durable, effective, but a bit too big.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, durable, effective. I gave up on expensive watches because they can only cause disappoinment and sadness whenever something goes wrong and needs to be fixed. The Timex Ironman is quite durable. My previous one eventually got some condensation inside after many years. With a watch in this price range, you don't need to fret; just get a new one. The "Indiglo" light button is very useful and effective. My only complaint is that it is quite bulky; it's almost 1/2 inch thick which means it doesn't easily fit under some sleeves, especially with sports apparel.
customer_reviews.author: N.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a cross-country runner and needed a watch to replace his misplaced Casio G-shock. I wasn't dropping that kind of money a second time, so I opted for this and he loves it. I was in the Army and wore Ironman watches throughout most of my 21 year career and they always served me well. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great sport watch!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, easy to read, lightweight (for you gram-counting weight weenies). This is my go-to watch for mountain biking, trail running, hiking as well as anywhere it'll get wet. My last one held up for probably 7-8 years (maybe longer) with one battery change and using an o-ring when the strap keeper broke. When the rubber faceplate lost a chunk, I finally knew it was time for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: EndlessShopper

customer_reviews.title: 4.85 STARS
customer_reviews.text: After decades, I made the switch... Casio to Timex. My "weekend/knock-around" watch MUST have two functions: (1) stop watch (as a science-oriented guy, I really do monitor the passage of time), and (2) a countdown timer (great for moving the sprinkler or reversing my morning walk to head home). I love the larger numerals than most digital watches have. Plus, I have become an INDIGLO fan. The only negative: I cannot find on the instruction sheet or on the Internet the type of battery my wonderful watch uses. I suppose I will have to discover that when I crack the watch open once it dies.
customer_reviews.author: James D. McLeod

customer_reviews.title: OKnwatch
customer_reviews.text: Small face.Tiny face printing. No instrctions. Totally defective. Able to set time only. Not able to set month & year. Buy something else. Defective Timex ironman knockoff. Excellent velcro strap. Doen't deserve one rating. small markins. Not fullsize. Goodvelcro strap.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Durable and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I was just looking for a watch that I could wear every day and not have to worry about. I work in some hot environments and with heavy machinery so I wanted something that could withstand any element it may face and thus far it has been great. Alarms work well and sound off loud. If you’re looking for a daily watch for the working person, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Warner

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: Wore these at work for decades. Bought a dress watch for looks, but it had very tiny dials for day and date. Between the blur of time during the pandemic and the match of time on my eyes, went back to the workhorse. Not pleased with my age and pandemic, love the watch and the service.
customer_reviews.author: GKN

customer_reviews.title: This is my fourth Timex Ironman series watch. This ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Timex Ironman series watch. This watch provides additional features, such as, alarms, larger dial, but retains the same buttons functions to reduce the need to read the manual extensively.
customer_reviews.author: Turnercw62

customer_reviews.title: Whats the Point of Having a Watch if You Can't See It
customer_reviews.text: What Timex genius thought that having a watch with a display that can't be read without activating the indiglo light would be a good idea??? Even in the full light of day its difficult to see. If you are in a dark room or even outside in the shade you can't see the display. USELESS!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Mclennan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to replace my previous Timex watch, since I really like the features: timer, chronometer, and three programmable alarms (every day, week day, or weekend-only). The wrist band is a little wider than I'm used to, but it's exactly as pictured. I love this watch, and would recommend it to anyone who like the sound of having three programmable alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Terry School Librarian

product_meta.title: Timex Ironman Classic 30 Full-Size 38mm Watch
product_meta.description:
The undisputed favorite in sport watches crosses nearly every finish line in the world. Built to be lightweight and sealed for water resistance, the iconic five-button design gives you direct access to all timers, alarms and of course our Indiglo night-light.




PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Language: :English
 * Product Dimensions :6 x 6 x 6 inches; 0.8 Ounces
 * Item model number :T5E901
 * Department :Unisex-adult
 * Batteries :1 Lithium Metal batteries required. (included)
 * Date First Available :October 1, 2001
 * Manufacturer :Timex
 * ASIN :B000AYTYLW

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #2,495 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #4 inMen's Wrist Watches 
    *  #695 inMen's Shops 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.5 out of 5 stars5,417 ratings The undisputed favorite in sport watches crosses nearly every finish line in the world. Built to be lightweight and sealed for water resistance, the iconic five-button design gives you direct access to all timers, alarms and of course our Indiglo night-light.
feature_bullets: Adjustable black 16 millimeter resin strap fits up to 8-inch wrist circumference
100-hour chronograph with 30-lap memory; 24-hour countdown timer.On-Screen Prompts Make Setting Easy Forward or Backward Setting
3 daily, weekday or weekend alarms; 24-hour military time mode; 3 time zones; Day, date and month calendar
Gray and black 38 millimeter resin case with acrylic lens; Gray digital display; Indiglo light-up watch dial
Water resistant to 100 meter (330 feet): In general, suitable for swimming and snorkeling, but not diving
